original: Lind, Ivan, lektor, Göteborg, f. 13/ 4/90 i Vitsand, Värml. 1., av August L. o. Anna Carlsson. G. 18 m. Greta Nycander. Adopt :barn : Karin f. 19, kontorist, Gbg, Lennart 24, Bertil 27. — Stud :ex. v. norra latin i Sthlm 09, fil. mag. i Upps. 13, fil. lic. 16, fil. dr 20. Vik. adj. i Vänersborg 15, tf. lär. v. Gbgs hand:inst. 16, ord. lär. i hand:geogr. o. sv. där sed. 1’?, bitr. lär. v. Gbgs handelsfhögskola 24-37. Verksam bland tyska civilfångar i Petrograd och Sibirien 17. Skr.: Stud. i Västkusthamnarnas ekon. geogr. (grad:avh. 20), Gbgs handel o. sjöfart 1637-1920 (23), d:o sed. 1860 (23), Lärob. i ekon. geogr. f. handels-gymn. (26), Svensk prosa f. handels-gymn. (28), Svenska f. handelsgymn. (36), Näringsgeogr. m. varukännedom (tills. m. N. Västhagen 39), upps. i Ymer, utg. Gbgs hand :kamm. stat. över utr rhandeln under krigsåren.
translated: Lind, Ivan, lecturer, Gothenburg, b. 13/4/90 in Vitsand, Värmland. First child of August L. and Anna Carlsson. Married since 1918 to Greta Nycander. Adopted children: Karin, born in 1919, office worker in Gothenburg, Lennart, born in 1924, and Bertil, born in 1927. Education: Finished upper secondary school at Norra Latin in Stockholm in 1909, Bachelor of Arts in Uppsala in 1913, Master of Arts in 1916, and Doctor of Philosophy in 1920. Temporary assistant teacher in Vänersborg in 1915, acting teacher at Gothenburg Handicraft Institute in 1916, permanent teacher in economic geography and Swedish since 191?, deputy teacher at Gothenburg School of Business from 1924 to 1937. Worked among German civilian prisoners in Petrograd and Siberia in 1917. Written works: Studies in the Economic Geography of West Coast Ports (doctoral dissertation, 1920), Gothenburg Trade and Shipping 1637-1920 (1923), the same since 1860 (1923), Textbook in Economic Geography for Commercial High Schools (1926), Swedish Prose for Commercial High Schools (1928), Swedish for Commercial High Schools (1936), Economic Geography with Knowledge of Goods (co-authored with N. Västhagen, 1939), published essays in Ymer (journal), edited statistics on foreign trade by the Gothenburg Chamber of Commerce during the war years.
